instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message:
Arrived with no liquid damage. Has a strange charging issue where it will run off a/c and charge battery the first few minutes its running but afterwards  it will either stop charging the battery and run off a/c adapter for a few minutes or stop charging the battery plus act like a/c adapter is not plugged in and only run off of battery. USB amp meter shows 20V at 0 amps when this occurs.

Battery shows normal condition 180 cycles.

Any ideas on this one?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message: Does it work with charger only (battery data cable disconnected)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message:
Be sure no corrosion around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Pay atention to <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>-22, <RESISTOR>R7060</RESISTOR>-62 and their traces.
Also clean battery cable and connector.
